definition: spray (sprig of a plant with blossoms)/cuttlefish (on dining menus)/(literary) beautiful woman
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)

sentences.english: Argent flowers were dotted among phoenixes.
sentences.chinese: 鸾鸟中间点缀着银色的花枝。

sentences.english: She dresses up fit to kill even to go out shopping.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至出外购物，也打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: I have lost my knife, which I often use for cutting flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我丢了把刀，我常用它来修花枝。

sentences.english: Under the same culturing conditions M. denudata var. dilutipurpurascens has hardly any axillary flowering branches.
sentences.chinese: 在相同的丰产栽培条件下，淡紫玉兰基本无腋花枝。
她总是打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: Does the sight of a cheerful jelly jar with daisies make your lover smile contentedly?
sentences.chinese: 一个画着雏菊的果冻罐会让你的爱人笑得花枝乱颤？

sentences.english: She doesn't love dressing up, this makes her in beautiful, very thin.
sentences.chinese: 她不爱打扮，这又使她在花枝招展中，格外单薄。

sentences.english: I give you my sprig of lilac.
sentences.chinese: 我献给你我的紫丁香花枝。

sentences.english: Hey. To you guys and this hot dress and calamari.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，敬你们和这件惹火洋装和炸花枝圈。

sentences.english: She likes get gussied up and goes to a dancing patty.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢打扮得花枝招展的去参加舞会。

sentences.english: A" just like you", Sung Temple into a wire, the only remnant of squid.
sentences.chinese: 一曲《偏偏喜欢你》，唱到鬓成丝，桃林只剩残花枝。

sentences.english: I never felt lonely while walked under the flower trees alone.
sentences.chinese: 花枝烂漫，即便一人独自徜徉未觉寂寞。

sentences.english: I am wearing simple dress everyday, stand in be gorgeously dressed among them.
sentences.chinese: 我每天穿着朴素的衣服，站在花枝招展的她们中间。

sentences.english: Stop to summer, with branches parting, Jiangnan much rain.
sentences.chinese: 驻足夏日，叹花枝别离，江南多烟雨。

sentences.english: She dolled herself up as though she was a girl of eighteen.
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，好像是个十八岁的姑娘似的。

definition: branches and tendrils/fig. overcomplicated or digressive
massage/snapped-off branch/sprig/to snap a twig (i.e. sth that requires very little effort)
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
